data.title: Word N-Grams
data.solution:
def solution(sentence, N):

    # Clean the string and tokenize
    sentence = sentence.replace(',', '')
    sentence = sentence.replace('.', '')
    sentence = sentence.upper().split()

    # Add underscores
    sentence = ['_'*(N-1) + word + '_'*(N-1) for word in sentence]

    # Get n-grams
    n_gram_list = []
    for word in sentence: 
        for i in range(0, len(word)-(N-1)):
            n_gram_list.append(word[i:i+N])

    # Remove duplicates and sort
    n_gram_list = list(set(n_gram_list))
    n_gram_list.sort()
    return n_gram_list

N = int(input())
sentence = input()

print(*solution(sentence, N))
data.statement:
Character N-grams are N-character slices of a text. They are widely used in Natural Language Processing for tasks such as text categorization or autocompletion. 

For instance, the word "COSMOLOGY" would have the following 3-grams: 
__C, _CO, COS, OSM, SMO, MOL, OLO, LOG, OGY, GY_, Y__

where the underscores are added for better capturing the beginning and end of words.

Given a sentence and a value of [[N]], you must output all <<unique>> character N-Grams found <<within individual words>>, as an alphabetically ordered string in capital letters separated by spaces. Underscores go after Z. 


<<Example>>
[[N]] = 4, [[sentence]] = 'Cosmology, love.'
Output: 'COSM E___ GY__ LOGY LOVE MOLO MY__ OGY_ OLOG OSMO OVE_ SMOL VE__ Y___ _COS _LOV _MY_ __CO __LO __MY ___C ___L ___M'

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testOut: COSM E___ GY__ LOGY LOVE MOLO MY__ OGY_ OLOG OSMO OVE_ SMOL VE__ Y___ _COS _LOV _MY_ __CO __LO __MY ___C ___L ___M

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
4
Cosmology is a branch of astronomy concerned with the study of the chronology of the universe.

In Cosmology, the Big Bang is the prevailing cosmological model

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
read s:string(256)
write list of n-grams
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] indicating what N-gram to compute for each word
<<Line 2:>> A string  [[sentence]].
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A string of all <<unique>> word N-grams in [[sentence]] in capital letters, alphabetically ordered, and separated by blank spaces.
